title: 110_hr4577
content: The Act titled "Student Visa Security Improvement Act" enhances background checks for student visas. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require thorough review of student visa applications to determine terrorist activities. A strategic plan for visa security operations, especially for students, must be developed. The Homeland Security Act of 2002 is amended to require a review of student visa applications for terrorist activities. A strategic plan for visa security operations, particularly for students, must be developed, and performance data must be maintained to show impact. Additional guidance on roles and responsibilities of employees assigned under this subsection will be reported and developed in consultation with the Secretary of State. SEC. 3. STUDENT AND EXCHANGE VISITOR PROGRAM. The amendment to Section 442 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 includes regulations for the Student and Exchange Visitor Program, requiring institutions to ensure active participation of covered students and exchange visitors. The amendment to Section 442 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 includes regulations for the Student and Exchange Visitor Program, requiring institutions to ensure active participation of covered students and exchange visitors. Covered students or exchange visitors must not be unobserved for more than 30 days during an academic term or program, or 60 days during any other period. Any transfers to another institution or program, or hospitalizations, must be reported to the Department within 21 days. The amendment to Section 442 of the Homeland Security Act of 2002 requires covered students or exchange visitors to be observed at least once every 60 days, even if hospitalized or incapacitated. The Secretary must provide access to the SEVIS system to authorized users of participating institutions or program sponsors. The Secretary must ensure that authorized users at participating institutions or exchange visitor sponsors are identified, with additional users for every 200 covered students or exchange visitors. Each authorized user must be certified after completing a training course provided by the Department. The Secretary will provide technical support options for the program, and upgrades to SEVIS or equivalent data will be made. The Secretary will update the program to include new data fields for verifying academic performance and timely entry of academic majors for covered students and exchange visitors. Nothing in this section shall prohibit the Secretary or any institution or exchange program sponsor participating in the Student Exchange Visitor Program. The proposed changes aim to prevent sponsors in the Student Exchange Visitor Program from requiring more frequent observations of covered students or exchange visitors. It also includes definitions for terms like 'covered student', 'observed', and 'authorized user'. The Comptroller General will conduct a review as well. The Comptroller General will review fees for the Student and Exchange Visitor Program of the Department of Homeland Security, including data from fiscal years 2004 through 2007 and all associated expenses. Authorization of appropriations for fiscal year 2009 to carry out sections 2 and 3 of the Act and related amendments.
